00033 /**
00034  * \file
00035  *         Device drivers for tmp102 temperature sensor in Zolertia Z1.
00036  * \author
00037  *         Enric M. Calvo, Zolertia <ecalvo@zolertia.com>

00042 #include <stdio.h>
00043 #include "contiki.h"
00044 #ifdef __IAR_SYSTEMS_ICC__
00045 #include <msp430.h>
00046 #else
00047 #include <io.h>
00048 #include <signal.h>
00049 #endif
00050 
00051 #include "i2cmaster.h"
00052 #include "tmp102.h"
00053 
00054 
00055 
00056 /* Bitmasks and bit flag variable for keeping track of tmp102 status. */
00057 enum TMP102_STATUSTYPES
00058 {
00059   /* must be a bit and not more, not using 0x00. */
00060   INITED = 0x01,
00061   RUNNING = 0x02,
00062   STOPPED = 0x04,
00063   LOW_POWER = 0x08,
00064   AAA = 0x10,                   // available to extend this...
00065   BBB = 0x20,                   // available to extend this...
00066   CCC = 0x40,                   // available to extend this...
00067   DDD = 0x80                    // available to extend this...
00068 };
00069 static enum TMP102_STATUSTYPES _TMP102_STATUS = 0x00;
00070 
00071 
00072 /*---------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00073 //PROCESS(tmp102_process, "Temperature Sensor process");
00074 
00075 /*---------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00076 /* Init the temperature sensor: ports, pins, registers, interrupts (none enabled), I2C,
00077     default threshold values etc. */
00078 
00079 void
00080 tmp102_init (void)
00081 {
00082   if (!(_TMP102_STATUS & INITED))
00083     {
00084       PRINTFDEBUG ("TMP102 init\n");
00085       _TMP102_STATUS |= INITED;
00086       /* Power Up TMP102 via pin */
00087       TMP102_PWR_DIR |= TMP102_PWR_PIN;
00088       TMP102_PWR_SEL &= ~TMP102_PWR_SEL;
00089       TMP102_PWR_SEL2 &= ~TMP102_PWR_SEL;
00090       TMP102_PWR_REN &= ~TMP102_PWR_SEL;
00091       TMP102_PWR_OUT |= TMP102_PWR_PIN;
00092 
00093       /* Set up ports and pins for I2C communication */
00094       i2c_enable ();
00095 
00096    }
00097 }
00098 
00099 /*---------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00100 /* Write to a 16-bit register.
00101     args:
00102       reg       register to write to
00103       val       value to write
00104 */
00105 
00106 void
00107 tmp102_write_reg (u8_t reg, u16_t val)
00108 {
00109   u8_t tx_buf[] = { reg, 0x00, 0x00 };
00110 
00111   tx_buf[1] = (u8_t) (val >> 8);
00112   tx_buf[2] = (u8_t) (val & 0x00FF);
00113 
00114   i2c_transmitinit (TMP102_ADDR);
00115   while (i2c_busy ());
00116   PRINTFDEBUG ("I2C Ready to TX\n");
00117 
00118   i2c_transmit_n (3, tx_buf);
00119   while (i2c_busy ());
00120   PRINTFDEBUG ("WRITE_REG 0x%04X @ reg 0x%02X\n", val, reg);
00121 }
00122 
00123 /*---------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00124 /* Read register.
00125     args:
00126       reg       what register to read
00127     returns the value of the read register type u16_t
00128 */
00129 
00130 u16_t
00131 tmp102_read_reg (u8_t reg)
00132 {
00133   u8_t buf[] = { 0x00, 0x00 };
00134   u16_t retVal = 0;
00135   u8_t rtx = reg;
00136   PRINTFDEBUG ("READ_REG 0x%02X\n", reg);
00137 
00138   // transmit the register to read 
00139   i2c_transmitinit (TMP102_ADDR);
00140   while (i2c_busy ());
00141   i2c_transmit_n (1, &rtx);
00142   while (i2c_busy ());
00143 
00144   // receive the data 
00145   i2c_receiveinit (TMP102_ADDR);
00146   while (i2c_busy ());
00147   i2c_receive_n (2, &buf[0]);
00148   while (i2c_busy ());
00149 
00150   retVal = (u16_t) (buf[0] << 8 | (buf[1]));
00151 
00152   return retVal;
00153 }
00154 
00155 /*---------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00156 /* Read temperature in a raw format. Further processing will be needed
00157    to make an interpretation of these 12 or 13-bit data, depending on configuration
00158 */
00159 
00160 u16_t
00161 tmp102_read_temp_raw (void)
00162 {
00163   u16_t rd = 0;
00164 
00165   rd = tmp102_read_reg (TMP102_TEMP);
00166 
00167   return rd;
00168 }
00169 
00170 /*---------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00171 /* Simple Read temperature. Return is an integer with temperature in 1deg. precision 
00172    Return value is a signed 8 bit integer.
00173 */
00174 
00175 int8_t
00176 tmp102_read_temp_simple (void)
00177 {
00178   int16_t raw = 0;
00179   int8_t rd = 0;
00180   int16_t sign = 1;
00181   int16_t abstemp, temp_int;
00182 
00183   raw = (int16_t) tmp102_read_reg (TMP102_TEMP);
00184   if(raw < 0) {
00185     abstemp = (raw ^ 0xFFFF) + 1;
00186     sign = -1;
00187   } else {
00188     abstemp = raw;
00189   }
00190 
00191   /* Integer part of the temperature value */
00192   temp_int = (abstemp >> 8) * sign;
00193 
00194   /* See test-tmp102.c on how to print values of temperature with decimals 
00195      fractional part in 1/10000 of degree 
00196      temp_frac = ((abstemp >>4) % 16) * 625; 
00197      Data could be multiplied by 63 to have less bit-growth and 1/1000 precision 
00198      Data could be multiplied by 64 (<< 6) to trade-off precision for speed 
00199   */
00200 
00201   rd = (int8_t) (temp_int);
00202   return rd;
00203 }
